subject: RE: [junit] JUnit @ SourceForge
msgSnippet: I see that JUnit @ SourceForge will not be supporting things like IDE Integration, I am planning on covering this on junit.org.  Will those sort of questions
messageBody:
I see that JUnit @ SourceForge will not be supporting things like
IDE Integration, I am planning on covering this on junit.org. Will
those sort of questions be welcome on the junit@sourceforge lists?

Can the support email (junit@...) be forwarded to those
lists as well?

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ray Power
> Sent: Wednesday, December 13, 2000 6:45 AM
> To: junit@egroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit @ SourceForge
>
>
> I agree, a very good idea.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Marko Schulz
> > Sent: Wednesday, December 13, 2000 2:29 PM
> > To: Erich Gamma
> > Cc: junit@egroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit @ SourceForge
> >
> >
> > On Mon, Dec 11, 2000 at 11:46:15PM -0500, Erich Gamma wrote:
> > > It took us some time...but we have finally set up JUnit as a
> SourceForge
> > > project.
> > >
> > > See http://sourceforge.net/projects/junit/
> >
> > With new forums and mailinglists. :-( Could they be closed and
> > replaced by pointers to this list? It is a pain to follow them all.
> >
> > --
> > marko schulz
> >
> > "Sind Comics Kunst?" "Ist doch scheiegal!"
> > Stefan Dinters Antwort auf eine Podiumsfrage,
> > Comicsalon 1997 in Hamburg
> >
